ðŸ”¹ **No, Gmail MCP Is Still There!**

Your Gmail MCP is still configured in your global MCP config at:  
[`/Users/nicholasfeyintolafolarin-coker/.cursor/mcp.json`](mcp:/Users/nicholasfeyintolafolarin-coker/.cursor/mcp.json)

It's under the `"partner_composio"` server:
```json
"partner_composio": {
  "url": "https://mcp.composio.dev/partner/composio/googlesheets?customerId=a84dd4e6-ada0-44b9-9157-6332907e1340&transport=sse&agent=cursor"
}
```

**Wait - that's Google Sheets, not Gmail!** 

Looking at your history, you definitely had Gmail MCP working before (I can see all the analysis from May). It appears the `partner_composio` entry might have been reconfigured for Google Sheets instead of Gmail.

ðŸ”¹ **Quick Fix:**

You need to add Gmail back. Based on your previous working setup, add this to your global MCP config:

```json
"gmail_composio": {
  "url": "https://mcp.composio.dev/partner/composio/gmail?customerId=a84dd4e6-ada0-44b9-9157-6332907e1340&transport=sse&agent=cursor"
}
```

Would you like me to restore your Gmail MCP configuration? ðŸ¤–
